page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY OF LINKENHOLT
page.content: Linkenholt was mentioned in Domesday spelt Linchelow meaning Wood on the Hill; the church was not mentioned until 1533. The population in 1861 was 88, in 1985 it is 50 - 40 adults and 10 children. A memorial in the church is to the Festing family long connected with the Parish as a Festing married into the Worgan family from the Manor. There are memorials to those killed in the 1914-18 War (one name) and in the 1939-45 War (two names). The old graveyard is now under the Manor garden as the church was moved in 1871 and the Festing family vault is probably there too.
